programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The War With Grandpa
programme.desc: When Grandpa Ed comes to stay, his grandson Peter must give up his beloved bedroom. However, Peter does not give way so easily, concocting a series of unexpected and unusual schemes to force his imposing grandfather out of his room for good. Based on the novel by Robert Kimmel Smith.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Farewell
programme.desc: After her beloved grandmother is diagnosed with terminal cancer, a Chinese-American woman returns to China for a family gathering secretly designed to say goodbye to the matriarch. However, when it becomes apparent that grandma is the only one unaware of the diagnosis, she struggles to keep the secret.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Sting
programme.desc: Paul Newman and Robert Redford star as Depression-era con men out to fool a big-time criminal in this Best Picture Oscar winner.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Leap of Faith
programme.desc: A charlatan claiming to be a faith healer is stranded in a backwater town in Kansas where a local sheriff gets wise to his scam.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom
programme.desc: Based on South African president Nelson Mandela's autobiography, this inspiring docudrama chronicles Mandela's youth, education and the nearly three decades he spent in prison before becoming the nation's president, as well as his role in rebuilding the country post-apartheid.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Evers
programme.desc: Family members discuss the life and legacy of civil rights activist Medgar Evers, former Field Secretary of the NAACP in Mississippi whose fight for freedom was tragically cut short by an assassin's bullet in 1963.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Meek's Cutoff
programme.desc: In this historical drama set in 1845, Stephen Meek (Bruce Greenwood) gets three pioneer families lost after being hired to guide them through the Oregon Trail, which leads to division and mistrust as the group fights for survival in the wilderness.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Love Means Zero
programme.desc: Featuring the life and work of American tennis coach Nick Bollettieri.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Genie's Tail, A
programme.desc: A young boy's puppy unearths a genie's lamp housing two Genie brothers. When the boy wishes one of the Genies into the puppy, magical mayhem ensues.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Saving Flora
programme.desc: A circus Elephant named Flora who can no longer perform her tricks is scheduled to be euthanized. However, the night before, Dawn, the circus owner's 14-year-old daughter, escapes from the circus together with Flora to take her away from danger. Dawn's mission is to take Flora to the elephant preserve where she will be safe from any harm. To achieve it, they will need to make it through kilometers of woods, an enraged river, and two elephant hunters.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Muhammad Ali: The Greatest. Of All Time.
programme.desc: Muhammad Ali talks a suicidal stranger down from a ledge, using his unique brand of wit and wisdom.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The House of Mirth
programme.desc: Strong performances, gorgeous costumes and sumptuous art direction distinguish this adaptation of Edith Wharton's novel. Gillian Anderson stars as a unmarried woman who falls from grace in early 20th-century New York City, where the upper classes have little use for an independent female who refuses to play by the rules. Eric Stoltz, Anthony LaPaglia, Laura Linney, Dan Aykroyd, Elizabeth McGovern.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Stephenie Meyer's romantic and suspenseful best seller that started the phenomenon comes to life in this action-packed chronicle of the modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson star. Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular "Twilight" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: The third installment of the electrifying "Twilight" saga finds Bella (Kristen Stewart) forced to choose between Edward (Robert Pattinson), a vampire and the love of her life, or Jacob Black (Taylor Lautner), a werewolf and her best friend. The result of her decision may reignite the ancient feud between vampires and werewolves, while a scorned vampire bent on revenge appears responsible for a string of brutal murders

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
programme.desc: In this magical installment of the "Twilight" saga, Bella becomes pregnant after marrying Edward, which leads to a dangerous childbirth and a shocking realization for werewolf Jacob Black.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
programme.desc: The sweeping conclusion to the "Twilight" series follows Bella, Edward and Jacob as they band together to fight a group of ancient vampires who are threatening to destroy Bella and Edward's family.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: The Nanny Diaries
programme.desc: Scarlett Johansson stars in this hilarious adaptation of the bestseller. A recent college grad takes a job as a live-in nanny for the troubled son of a snooty, neurotic Upper East Side socialite and her nasty, adulterous husband. Laura Linney, Alicia Keys, Chris Evans, Donna Murphy, Paul Giamatti. Directed by Shari Springer Berman and Robert Pulcini.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Kate & Leopold
programme.desc: Meg Ryan and Hugh Jackman are charming in this time-tripping romantic comedy. Jackman plays the Duke of Albany, who is whisked through a portal in time from 1876 to modern-day Manhattan, where a romance begins when he woos a jaded executive (Ryan). Directed by James Mangold ("Girl, Interrupted"). Liev Schreiber, Breckin Meyer, Natasha Lyonne.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: Center Stage
programme.desc: This backstage drama takes a penetrating look at the ambitions, romances and heartbreaks of a tight-knit group of aspiring young ballet dancers. Chief among the students, who have just been accepted to New York's prestigious American Ballet Company, is plucky Jody Sawyer (Amanda Schull), who falls for the company's reigning star while dealing with its demanding director. Ethan Stiefel.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Oscar-nominated adaptation of Jane Austen's novel about the still-single Dashwood sisters and how they cope with men, marriage and money after their father dies. The screenplay (written by star Emma Thompson) was the sole Oscar winner out of seven nominations.

programme.title: All I Want for Christmas (2021)
programme.desc: A young girl stumbles upon a Christmas caper involving a fleet of small robots that just might not be the toys they seem, while helping several friends get Santa's attention for putting them on the naughty list.

programme.desc: Lacy, a career-driven business woman, goes to a B&B in Illinois at the advice of a new therapist. There she finds herself stuck in a mystical, small Christmas town, reliving the same day over and over. Lacy must figure out how to escape.

programme.channel: USA | Showtime Family Zone East HD
programme.title: A Very British Christmas
programme.desc: American opera singer Jessica Bailey's flight to her concert in Vienna becomes delayed in a remote area of England. The only place to stay is a bed-and-breakfast in Pine Falls, an enchanting village run by a young, handsome, widower Andrew with his precocious daughter, Katie. Spending time with them allows romance to blossom as Jessica learns he is an amazing artist, but a struggling entrepreneur. With snowflakes in the air, Jessica faces a choice: career or love.

programme.title: Santa Claus: The Movie

programme.desc: More inspired silliness finds Lt. Drebin coaxed out of retirement to take down Rocco the terrorist. After going undercover and assisting in a Shawshank style prison break, Drebin discovers Rocco has access to powerful explosives and his target is the Academy Awards ceremony.

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an attempted assassination, thereby incurring the wrath of a maniacal Irish radical. After seemingly neutralizing the villains he decides to celebrate the occasion with his family, but then all hell breaks loose.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and Meryl Streep star in Jonathan Demme's absorbing remake of the 1962 political thriller. Washington plays a Gulf War vet troubled by nightmares about his time in Kuwait. Liev Schreiber is excellent as a soldier who served under him before returning to the States, where he has embarked on a promising political career. Directors Roger Corman and Sidney Lumet have cameos. Tina Sinatra, whose father Frank starred in the original, co-produced.

Both Brandon de Wilde as the youngster who idolizes Shane, and Jack Palance, as a cold-blooded hired gunman, were nominated for Best Supporting Actor.

programme.title: Branson
programme.desc: The history of Virgin Galactic, from conception to test flights, and the controversial bid from Virgin Atlantic to obtain government support during the Covid-19 pandemic. As the first passenger flight of Virgin Galactic approaches, Branson defends the benefits of privately funded space exploration and the paradoxes around Virgin's eco-messaging. Set for July 11, 2021, the launch day follows 17 years of research, testing, accidents, and setbacks, culminating in a successful flight.

programme.desc: The columnist for a national housekeeping magazine, as part of a promotional stunt, welcomes a returning war hero into her country estate, the only problem is she's a klutz in the kitchen, where she's never been at home on the range.

programme.title: Wild Indian
programme.desc: This thriller follows the lives of Michael and his cousin Ted-O decades after they took part in the murder and cover-up of a classmate. Michael has reinvented himself whilst Ted-O is fresh out of jail. But Ted-O wants to clear his conscience and Michael cannot afford the truth to be known.

programme.title: Summertime
programme.desc: This loosely structured dramedy follows the intersecting lives of 25 young Angelinos as they go about Los Angeles on a single hot summer day. A fast-food worker, a roller skating guitarist, and two aspiring rappers turn to creative self-expression to give voice to their hopes, traumas, joys, and agonies.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: Camille and Valmont are caught in a dangerous situation after working on a new plan to face their past ghosts.

programme.title: Measure of Revenge
programme.desc: Measure of Revenge tells the story of theater actress Lillian Cooper, whose son dies mysteriously. When the death is ruled an accidental overdose, Lillian decides to investigate on her own, allying with her son's drug dealer, Taz. This investigation immerses her in her rock star son's underground world. Along the way, she hallucinates many of the iconic characters she has portrayed, all of whom encourage her to solve the mystery and seek vengeance.

programme.title: In Her Shoes
programme.desc: Toni Collette and Cameron Diaz shine as a pair of mismatched sisters in this touching character study. Collette is the sensible, driven one, and Diaz is an irresponsible, self-centered party girl who may have stepped on her sibling's toes once too often. Shirley MacLaine is excellent as their grandmother, a Florida retiree whom the women thought was dead. Directed by Curtis Hanson. Mark Feuerstein, Ken Howard, Candice Azzara, Norman Lloyd, Francine Beers.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: Camille and Valmont are caught in a dangerous situation after working on a new plan to face their past ghosts.

programme.title: Good
programme.desc: Payton aspires to climb the social ladder of his community by marrying into an affluent family. When hired as a caretaker to the elderly and well-off Gregory, Payton believes he has finally found the path to achieving his aspirations. Yet as the unlikely duo grows closer and Gregory divulges the secrets of his turbulent past, Payton is inspired to confront his own issues in the pregnant ex-girlfriend he abandoned in his quest for riches.

programme.title: Queen of the Capital
programme.desc: This vivacious documentary follows Muffy Blake Stephyns, a drag performer with high aspirations. Muffy and her everyday persona, Daniel, navigate the drag and bureaucratic worlds of Washington, D.C., while following her dream to lead a colorful group of philanthropic drag performers. Using skills from a former life as a campaign consultant, she runs for Empress of the Imperial Court of D.C.

programme.title: Snow Flower and the Secret Fan
programme.desc: Bingbing Li and Gianna Jun star in this touching drama about the friendship between two young girls living in 19th-century China, who communicate with each other by trading messages hidden inside a folding fan. Later, the girls' descendants struggle to maintain their friendship while dealing with the complications of life in 21st-century Shanghai.

programme.title: Pretty Bird
programme.desc: Three entrepreneurs chase a dream to revolutionize personal travel by creating a jet-propelled "rocket belt," but personality clashes, mistrust and delusions of grandeur threaten to torpedo their million-dollar idea. Nominated for a Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival.

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: In this suspenseful, well-plotted and beautifully acted legal thriller, an attorney who's brought a wrongful-death lawsuit against a gun manufacturer, a jury consultant working for the company, and a member of the jury cross paths. The film is based on a John Grisham bestseller.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: A spoiled, clever English society woman plays matchmaker to everyone she knows in this adaptation of the 1816 Jane Austen novel. Gwyneth Paltrow, Jeremy Northam, Toni Collette, Greta Scacchi.

programme.title: The Red Turtle
programme.desc: A man is shipwrecked on an island inhabited by majestic animals, where he soon establishes a family and a new life. This rapturous animated tale is told entirely without dialogue.

programme.title: Snow Flower and the Secret Fan
programme.desc: Bingbing Li and Gianna Jun star in this touching drama about the friendship between two young girls living in 19th-century China, who communicate with each other by trading messages hidden inside a folding fan. Later, the girls' descendants struggle to maintain their friendship while dealing with the complications of life in 21st-century Shanghai.

programme.title: Measure of Revenge
programme.desc: Measure of Revenge tells the story of theater actress Lillian Cooper, whose son dies mysteriously. When the death is ruled an accidental overdose, Lillian decides to investigate on her own, allying with her son's drug dealer, Taz. This investigation immerses her in her rock star son's underground world. Along the way, she hallucinates many of the iconic characters she has portrayed, all of whom encourage her to solve the mystery and seek vengeance.

programme.title: City of Lies
programme.desc: A detective and a journalist, both fallen from grace, unite to refuel their obsession with one of the best known unsolved murders in history - the murder of Christopher "Notorious B.I.G." Wallace. Based on the book by Randall Sullivan, this crime drama also delves deep into the murder of Tupac Shakur, the suspicious circumstances surrounding both deaths, and the much-speculated gang or LAPD involvement in the cases.

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: A spoiled, clever English society woman plays matchmaker to everyone she knows in this adaptation of the 1816 Jane Austen novel. Gwyneth Paltrow, Jeremy Northam, Toni Collette, Greta Scacchi.

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: In this suspenseful, well-plotted and beautifully acted legal thriller, an attorney who's brought a wrongful-death lawsuit against a gun manufacturer, a jury consultant working for the company, and a member of the jury cross paths. The film is based on a John Grisham bestseller.

programme.title: Jockey
programme.desc: Aging jockey Jackson refuses to admit that his body can no longer withstand the demands of the sport. When rookie jockey Gabriel arrives at the track, Jackson feels inspired by the young man's grit and vows to claim one final championship before his time is up, all the while grappling with an unexpected revelation from Gabriel.

programme.title: The Squid and the Whale
programme.desc: Two boys cope with their parents' divorce in writer-director Noah Baumbach's award-winning indie starring Jeff Daniels as a Brooklyn college professor and Laura Linney as his writer wife. Jesse Eisenberg, Owen Kline, Halley Feiffer, Anna Paquin, William Baldwin.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: Camille and Valmont are caught in a dangerous situation after working on a new plan to face their past ghosts.

programme.title: Redbelt
programme.desc: Writer-director David Mamet's riveting drama touches on the worlds of mixed martial arts, Hollywood and shady con men. Chiwetel Ejiofor gives a knock-out performance as a jujitsu instructor who gets conned into fighting in a money bout after getting backed into a financial corner. Mamet is a practitioner of jujitsu. Alice Braga, Tim Allen, Ricky Jay, Joe Mantegna. Mixed-martial-arts fighter Randy Couture costars.

programme.title: City of Lies
programme.desc: A detective and a journalist, both fallen from grace, unite to refuel their obsession with one of the best known unsolved murders in history - the murder of Christopher "Notorious B.I.G." Wallace. Based on the book by Randall Sullivan, this crime drama also delves deep into the murder of Tupac Shakur, the suspicious circumstances surrounding both deaths, and the much-speculated gang or LAPD involvement in the cases.

programme.title: Breaking Up
programme.desc: Russell Crowe and Salma Hayek star as an on-again, off-again couple whose relationship works only when they're having sex. Minister: Abraham Alvarez. Directed by Robert Greenwald.

programme.title: I'm Charlie Walker
programme.desc: In the early 1970s, a man must deal with a racist Bay Area corporation as he cleans up a massive oil spill. Charlie Walker, a black contractor who had trouble finding work, takes it upon himself to break the mold and make a name for himself. Based on a true story.

programme.title: Redbelt
programme.desc: Writer-director David Mamet's riveting drama touches on the worlds of mixed martial arts, Hollywood and shady con men. Chiwetel Ejiofor gives a knock-out performance as a jujitsu instructor who gets conned into fighting in a money bout after getting backed into a financial corner. Mamet is a practitioner of jujitsu. Alice Braga, Tim Allen, Ricky Jay, Joe Mantegna. Mixed-martial-arts fighter Randy Couture costars.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: Frances O'Connor stars in this updated version of Jane Austen's novel about an independent woman. Writer-director Patricia Rozema imbues the story with a modern sensibility, making strong points about the expectations of 19th-century women to marry and look pretty. Embeth Davidtz, Jonny Lee Miller.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: The jaded nobility of pre-revolutionary France finds a marquise entreating her ex-lover to seduce a virgin in retaliation against another of her ex-lovers, who plans to marry the maiden.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: In the series premiere, young lovers Camille and Valmont fight for a better life but find themselves at war with each other.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: Camille's new future hangs in the balance, and a face from the past triggers a long-buried need for revenge.

programme.title: Smokin' Aces
programme.desc: This explosive, energetic crime opus, set in a glitzy Lake Tahoe hotel, rides shotgun with a wild collection of assassins as they gun for lowlife magician Buddy "Aces" Israel (Jeremy Piven), who is turning state's evidence against the mob. Ben Affleck, Ray Liotta, Ryan Reynolds, Taraji Henson, Andy Garcia, Peter Berg. Wayne Newton has a cameo as himself. Singer Alicia Keys and rapper Common make their big-screen debuts. Written and directed by Joe Carnahan.

programme.title: The One
programme.desc: Jet Li plays multiple roles in this sci-fi actioner. In a cosmos with 125 parallel universes, a killer (Li) skips between dimensions to murder other versions of himself. But he finds a formidable foe in the last remaining version---a kindly L.A. cop (also Li) with a really mean kick. Carla Gugino, Delroy Lindo. Directed by James Wong.

programme.title: The Raid: Redemption
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of Jakarta's slums lies an impenetrable safe house for the world's most dangerous killers and gangsters. Until now, the run-down apartment block has been considered untouchable to even the bravest of police. Cloaked under the cover of pre-dawn darkness and silence, an elite swat team is tasked with raiding the safe house in order to take down the notorious drug lord that runs it.

programme.title: Halloween Kills
programme.desc: Laurie Strode comes out triumphant in her showdown with Michael Myers after she leaves him burning in a cage in her basement. Though badly injured, she begins to feel a sense of relief, thinking she has finally gotten rid of her lifelong tormentor. When the bloodbath resumes, she is alerted that the evil serial killer has survived and that once again, she has to gear up to take him on. This time, however, Haddonfield rallies behind her, intent on eliminating Michael once and for all.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: A Naval Officer who slept with the US Secretary of Defense's mistress is tasked with rooting the KGB mole accused of murdering her, but realizes that he has become a pawn in an elaborate cover up to protect the murderous politician.

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A 21st-century construction worker discovers that his entire memory of the past derives from a chip implanted in his brain.

programme.title: Disturbing Behavior
programme.desc: Katie Holmes and James Marsden star in this chiller as high-school misfits who suspect something's amiss about their seemingly perfect classmates. As they delve into the mystery, they fear they'll be the next unwilling members of the sinister club of vicious conformists.

programme.title: Life of Pi
programme.desc: In this visually stunning adventure drama, a zookeeper's son is stranded at sea aboard a lifeboat with a zebra, an orangutan, a hyena and a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker.

programme.title: Lucky You
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore and Eric Bana are aces in this winning comedy-romance set in and around Las Vegas casinos. She's an aspiring lounge singer who falls for a poker-playing stud (Bana) who lives fast, plays hard and has a tendency to win big and lose bigger. Robert Duvall costars as Bana's cardsharp-legend dad. Debra Messing, Jean Smart. Directed by Curtis Hanson, who cowrote the script with Eric Roth. Features cameos by real-life poker superstars Daniel Negreanu, Sammy Farha and Phil Hellmuth.

programme.title: Burn After Reading
programme.desc: Two hapless gym employees find a computer disc containing a CIA agent's company secrets and decide to blackmail him to pay for plastic surgery.

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: Irishman Colin Farrell plays an egotistical, Bronx-born publicist who's held hostage in a public telephone booth at a busy New York City intersection. His captor: a menacing, self-righteous sniper (Kiefer Sutherland). This taut and entertaining thriller is a briskly paced morality play from director Joel Schumacher. Forest Whitaker, Katie Holmes, Radha Mitchell.

programme.title: A Bridge Too Far
programme.desc: Allied military leaders concoct an elaborate plan to capture a Nazi-held bridge in Holland. Their ambitions get them into serious trouble when they discover there are far more enemy troops stationed there than they had imagined.

programme.title: The Forever Purge
programme.desc: An unorthodox society partakes in a twelve-hour period of legalized crime once every year, allowing the citizens' wildest and darkest fantasies to come to light. However, things quickly descend into chaos as the crimes escalate in violence and the death toll continues to rise in this final installment of "The Purge" franchise.

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: A man with short-term memory loss tries to avenge a brutal crime in this mesmerizing and inventive drama, which unfolds in reverse chronological order.

programme.title: Erased
programme.desc: An ex-CIA agent and his estranged teenage daughter are targeted for death in Belgium in this tense tale of international espionage, and they must rely on each other in order to expose the conspiracy that threatens both of their lives.

programme.title: Arsenal
programme.desc: This tense action thriller centers on a construction-company owner who must rescue his brother, a petty crook, after he is abducted by a vicious mobster. He is aided in his quest by a police detective and longtime friend.

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: Will Smith stars in this adaptation of Isaac Asimov's classic sci-fi stories, a thrilling blend of high-tech effects and slam-bang action. Smith plays a cop who uncovers a conspiracy involving murderous robots in 2035, but he's unable to get anyone to believe him.

programme.title: Marked for Death
programme.desc: A retired DEA agent takes down a Jamaican drug gang that has overrun his hometown.

programme.title: Kiss the Girls
programme.desc: Strong performances and a taut script drive this pulse-pounding thriller about a forensic psychologist (Morgan Freeman) tracking an elusive serial killer. Helping him is a medical intern (Ashley Judd)---the only abductee to escape the killer's dungeon. Cary Elwes, Tony Goldwyn, Jay O. Sanders, Bill Nunn.

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: In this rip-roaring sequel, amnesiac Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone wrong. Bourne is then cornered into using his accomplished assassin techniques to fight for survival and clear his name.

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Gripping epic, set just prior to WWII, bursts at the seams with charismatic star turns by Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. She's a prim English aristocrat who returns to Australia to claim an inherited ranch, and he's a rugged drover who helps her battle wealthy land-grabbers trying to steal it from her. To make matters worse, the Japanese are threatening to invade the continent. Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson, Essie Davis, Brandon Walters. Produced, cowritten and directed by Baz Luhrmann.

programme.title: Krull
programme.desc: Arthurian sci-fi epic about a warrior-prince who sets out to rescue his bride from hostile space invaders. He gets help from a band of colorful characters including escaped convicts, a giant cyclops and a cowardly magician.

programme.title: Dude, Where's My Car?
programme.desc: Two slackers have an excellent adventure in this riotous comedy. After a wild night they don't remember, dimwits Jesse (Ashton Kutcher) and Chester (Seann William Scott) search valiantly for Jesse's missing car. Along the way, they encounter a money-hungry transsexual stripper, a spacy group of extraterrestrial loonies and killer ostriches. Kristy Swanson, Hal Sparks.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: This taut William Friedkin thriller features powerhouse performances by Tommy Lee Jones and Samuel L. Jackson. Jackson plays a Marine colonel on trial for a mission that went horribly wrong; Jones is his lawyer, a friend who doubts his innocence. Ben Kingsley,Guy Pearce, Bruce Greenwood.

programme.title: The Book Thief
programme.desc: In this thought-provoking drama, a young girl moves in with foster parents in Nazi Germany and shares her love of books she's stolen along the way with the Jewish man who has sought refuge in her new home.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy.

programme.title: The Forgotten
programme.desc: Julianne Moore ("The Hours") and Gary Sinise ("CSI: New York") star in a riveting thriller you'll never forget. Moore plays a mother who's grieving over the loss of her son when she's told the child never existed. Dominic West, Anthony Edwards, Alfre Woodard.

programme.title: What Happens in Vegas
programme.desc: A charming Cameron Diaz stars as an uptight stock trader who meets and marries immature slacker Ashton Kutcher one drunken night in Las Vegas. They agree to an annulment---until he wins a $3 million jackpot with her quarter. Ordered by a judge to live for six months as husband and wife before either can claim the prize, they're bound to fall in love---if they don't kill each other first. Lake Bell

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Gripping and ripping remake of the 1957 Western about a small-time rancher (Christian Bale) escorting a murderous outlaw (Russell Crowe) to a rendezvous with the law and a train that will take him to prison. Meanwhile, the desperado's henchmen try to head them off and free their leader, because without him they're "like a pack of dogs without a master." Directed by James Mangold, from a 1953 short story by Elmore Leonard. Ben Foster, Gretchen Mol, Dallas Roberts, Alan Tudyk, Peter Fonda.

programme.title: Narc
programme.desc: Two disturbed detectives join forces to investigate an undercover cop's murder. As they develop mutual respect for one another, unethical conduct reveals dark truths that could split them apart. Writer-director Joe Carnahan shot the film in 27 days, and spent the last 10 working on the climactic finale set in an actual chop shop.

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding crime thriller, a man working in an illegal scheme funneling cash to the local organized-crime syndicate through "money drops" gets caught in the crossfire of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A reporter goes undercover to prove that a high-powered ad exec murdered her childhood friend. Halle Berry and Bruce Willis star in this suspenseful and twist-filled mystery. Giovanni Ribisi, Richard Portnow, Gary Dourdan, Florencia Lozano. Directed by James Foley.

programme.title: Iris
programme.desc: Kate Winslet and Judi Dench received Oscar nominations for their robust portrayals of novelist Iris Murdoch, whose eccentrically ebullient lifestyle degenerated into a losing battle with Alzheimer's disease. Jim Broadbent earned a Best Supporting Actor Oscar as her doting husband, John Bayley. Hugh Bonneville, Penelope Wilton.

programme.title: W.
programme.desc: Josh Brolin gives a pitch-perfect performance as President George W. Bush in Oliver Stone's provocative and semisatiric biopic tracing Bush's transformation from a privileged, partying frat boy to a born-again Christian and conservative politician. Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, James Cromwell, Richard Dreyfuss.

programme.title: Absolute Power
programme.desc: This gripping thriller tells the story of a master thief who breaks into a D.C. mansion and witnesses a murder involving the President. As a result, the thief becomes a marked man. Resisting his instinct to flee, he decides to fight for justice.

programme.title: Mickey Blue Eyes
programme.desc: A British expat working in Manhattan as an auctioneer falls in love with a mobster's daughter in this hilarious comedy. When he tries to ingratiate himself with her family, he ends up involved in criminal activity and is forced to pose as a wiseguy from Kansas City.

programme.title: Last Night
programme.desc: While a man is away on a business trip, his wife (Keira Knightley) considers cheating on him with an old flame in this intimate drama. Meanwhile, he finds himself drawn to a sultry new coworker. Directed by Massy Tadjedin.

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: This wonderfully unconventional biopic of Beach Boy composer Brian Wilson focuses on two seminal periods in his life: his creative triumphs and mental breakdown as a young man, and his struggles in middle age to wrench free from a domineering therapist.

programme.title: A Rodeo Film
programme.desc: A Black bull rider in rural California must choose between his brother and the woman he loves.

programme.title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
programme.desc: Best Actor Oscar nominee Johnny Depp perfectly embodies the title role in Tim Burton's bloody well-done adaptation of the Stephen Sondheim musical about the vengeful owner of a tonsorial parlor that offers customers more than just a shave and a haircut. Helena Bonham Carter costars as Mrs. Lovett, who makes a killing with her new pie recipe containing a special meaty ingredient.

programme.title: This Is Where I Leave You
programme.desc: In this wry comedy, four adult siblings reunite for their father's funeral, along with a host of childhood friends, spouses past and present and their uncomfortably talkative mom.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: Julia Roberts heads a strong ensemble cast in this moving drama about the power of individuality. Roberts plays a progressive 1950s Wellesley College art professor, who runs afoul of the faculty when she teaches her students to reach for the stars.

programme.title: After the Sunset
programme.desc: Pierce Brosnan and Salma Hayek star in this thrilling and romantic adventure about two semiretired jewel thieves who plan one last heist. Woody Harrelson costars as the determined FBI agent who wants to bring them down.

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: Nerds of the world unite in this disarmingly funny sleeper. A rural high-school geek with a very bizarre family hatches a plan to get a girlfriend and become cool by helping his equally odd friend run for class president.

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham
programme.desc: You don't have to be a soccer fan to get a kick out of this delightful coming-of-age comedy. It's the story of an English teen (Parminder K. Nagra) whose dreams of athletic stardom clash with the wishes of her traditional Sikh family. The title refers to British soccer phenom David Beckham. Gurinder Chadha directed. Keira Knightley, Jonathan Rhys-Meyers, Anupam Kher, Alan Paxton, Juliet Stevenson, Shaheen Khan, Ameet Chana.

programme.title: Gone Baby Gone
programme.desc: Ben Affleck makes an impressive directorial debut with this gritty thriller about two street-smart private eyes (Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan) investigating the mysterious disappearance of a little girl in a working-class Boston neighborhood. Morgan Freeman, Ed Harris, John Ashton, Amy Ryan, Amy Madigan.

programme.title: Big Game
programme.desc: After narrowly escaping an assassination attempt on Air Force One, the president ends up stranded in the wilderness of Finland in this pulse-pounding thriller. A 13-year-old hunter soon finds him, and they work together to evade a group of terrorists.

programme.title: Halloween Kills
programme.desc: Laurie Strode comes out triumphant in her showdown with Michael Myers after she leaves him burning in a cage in her basement. Though badly injured, she begins to feel a sense of relief, thinking she has finally gotten rid of her lifelong tormentor. When the bloodbath resumes, she is alerted that the evil serial killer has survived and that once again, she has to gear up to take him on. This time, however, Haddonfield rallies behind her, intent on eliminating Michael once and for all.

programme.title: Home Fries
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore is utterly adorable as a pregnant restaurant cashier who falls for an Air National Guard reservist (Luke Wilson) in this delightful black comedy. Catherine O'Hara is a hoot as the unhinged wife of the baby's father. Jake Busey, Kim Robillard, Shelley Duvall.

programme.title: A Walk in the Woods
programme.desc: In this droll comedy-drama, an aging travel writer decides to go on one last adventure by hiking the 2200 miles of the Appalachian Trail with an eccentric friend. Along the way, the pair meet other determined oddballs and learn life lessons about mortality and friendship.

programme.title: The Mule
programme.desc: A 90-year old retired veteran desperately takes on a delivery job to save his failing business. What he thought was a simple job, turned out to be a drug run for a Mexican cartel. After becoming successful at it, he comes to the attention of a ruthless DEA agent, and that's when the mistakes of his past come back to haunt him. He must now redeem his sins before either the law or the cartel catch up to him.

programme.title: The Bourne Identity
programme.desc: Matt Damon stars in this well-executed adaptation of Robert Ludlum's bestselling thriller. The story centers on an amnesiac CIA assassin who embarks on a desperate race to save his own life after he is deemed expendable by his superiors. Franka Potente, Chris Cooper, Clive Owen, Brian Cox, Adewale Akinnouye-Agbaje, Julia Stiles.

programme.title: School Ties
programme.desc: A promising football player who wins a scholarship to a 1950s prep school must conceal his religion from his teammates and friends.

programme.title: Extract
programme.desc: Personal disaster yields big laughs when factory owner Joel (Jason Bateman) finds his marriage and career on the rocks after an employee has an accident and threatens to sue. Ben Affleck, Mila Kunis, Kristen Wiig. Written and directed by Mike Judge.

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: Jude Law defines charisma in this funny, insightful and sometimes poignant portrait of an unabashed philanderer. Law plays Alfie, a Manhattan chauffeur who begins to reevaluate his shallow ideas about women and romance. The comedy-drama is a remake of the 1966 Michael Caine film of the same name. Marisa Tomei, Susan Sarandon, Jane Krakowski, Nia Long, Omar Epps.

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: A gubernatorial candidate hires a campaign worker to keep his imbecilic brother out of trouble.

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Created in a San Francisco lab by an ambitious father-and-son scientist team seeking to cure Alzheimer's disease, genetically engineered chimp Caesar (Andy Serkis) uses his powerful intellect to lead an ape uprising in this thrilling sci-fi prequel.

programme.title: A Journal for Jordan
programme.desc: In the early 2000s, Charles Monroe King, a sergeant, awaits deployment to Iraq to fight in the war. He is married to Dana, and they recently had a newborn son named Jordan. Dana gifts Charles a journal notebook so he can write to his son his musings and life lessons he wants to share.

programme.title: The Unholy
programme.desc: This film based on the novel Shrine by James Herbert sees a journalist investigate the supernatural abilities of a young girl after an alleged visit from the Virgin Mary. Traveling to a small New England town, the journalist begins to uncover a more sinister truth surrounding the girl in this gothic horror film.

programme.title: 22 Jump Street
programme.desc: Schmidt and Jenko go undercover on a college campus, posing as students to bust criminal activity amid the undergrads in this hilarious sequel to the hit comedy "21 Jump Street."

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: A new team is protecting the earth from a special kind of shapeshifting alien in this sci-fi comedy adventure. But as two agents attempt to defend the earth against this alien threat, another enemy closer to home penetrates the organization in the form of a mole.

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Director Tim Burton reimagines the 1968 sci-fi classic in this visually stunning feature set in 2029. Mark Wahlberg stars as an astronaut who crash-lands on a planet where dignified apes rule with an iron fist and subservient humans are treated like chattel. Helena Bonham Carter, Tim Roth, Michael Clarke Duncan, Paul Giamatti, Kris Kristofferson, David Warner, Estella Warren.

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent
programme.desc: When his money gets tight, actor Nicolas Cage stumbles upon the ideal scheme to earn quick cash when an eccentric billionaire and longtime admirer invites him to make a paid appearance at his upcoming birthday party. Yet unbeknownst to his fan and secret drug runner, Cage doubles as a CIA informant intent on taking down the kingpin's smuggling operation.

programme.title: The Misfits
programme.desc: This action-adventure sees a notorious thief escape maximum security prison only to find himself lured in by The Misfits, an unconventional group of criminals. He learns that the plan is to undertake a huge gold heist and that the owner of the gold is his enemy - the man who put him behind bars.

programme.title: Masquerade
programme.desc: While home alone, Rose comes face-to-face with the young woman's nightmare when a band of thieving thugs breaks into the home, intent on pilfering her family's collection of valuable artwork. Yet Rose's unexpected appearance causes the home invaders to reassess their plans with murderous intent.

programme.title: The Unholy
programme.desc: This film based on the novel Shrine by James Herbert sees a journalist investigate the supernatural abilities of a young girl after an alleged visit from the Virgin Mary. Traveling to a small New England town, the journalist begins to uncover a more sinister truth surrounding the girl in this gothic horror film.

programme.title: Lila and Eve
programme.desc: Two mothers grieve the murders of their respective children. When the police prove incapable of apprehending those responsible, the women team up to fight crime as vigilantes in this riveting thriller.

programme.title: Thor: The Dark World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fantasy sequel, Thor must team up with his mischievous brother Loki in order to defeat a Dark Elf who's plotting to destroy all of existence. Meanwhile, his true love Jane Foster is possessed by a cosmic force.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle

programme.desc: Philadelphia's unified 122-pound world champion Stephen Fulton Jr. battles L.A.'s Danny Roman, from The Armory in Minneapolis. Also: Minneapolis fan-favorite David Morrell Jr. takes on Kalvin Henderson in a 168-pound co-main event.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: Grappling with the onset of middle age, a Chinese immigrant discovers that she can traverse across time and space. Teaming up with her alternate lives, the unlikely allies realize that they alone possess the power to protect the world from calamity, plunging them into the midst of an outlandish quest.

programme.title: Wifelike
programme.desc: An artificially intelligent being named Meredith receives her latest assignment as a companion to widower William. An anti-android exploitation advocacy group alters Meredith's programming and she starts remembering a past life she never knew she had. What follows is a deep dive into the nature of reality, existence, and what it means to be truly human.

programme.title: Immanence
programme.desc: Radio astronomers discover a mysterious signal in the deep sea that could be contact with extraterrestrials. After several terrifying manifestations threaten their beliefs, the team must fight to survive the ultimate evil.

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Moody crime drama about a detective with a haunted past. Her probe of a grisly killing points to two high-schoolers who have done their homework when it comes to pulling off a "perfect murder."

programme.title: The Mod Squad
programme.desc: The 1968-73 TV series is stylishly updated for the 1990s, with Claire Danes, Giovanni Ribisi and Omar Epps well cast as juvenile delinquents who must pay their debt to society by working as undercover officers for an LAPD detective (Dennis Farina). The plot involves the hip trio investigating a drug ring. Josh Brolin, Steve Harris, Sam McMurray, Richard Jenkins, Larry Brandenburg.

programme.title: Margaux
programme.desc: Eager for a weekend getaway of parties and relaxation, a group of twentysomethings rents a smart home vacation rental. Yet the home's sophisticated artificial intelligence programming system soon takes control, forcing the friends to fight their way out or face their end.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: When a murderer is killed in a police shoot-out, he invokes a voodoo spell that allows him to transfer his spirit into a doll.

programme.title: Crawlspace
programme.desc: A plumber is trapped in the crawlspace of a ruthless poachers' cabin.

programme.title: Givers of Death
programme.desc: The tale unfolds from three points of view; a man, a detective, and a city in ruin, all dealing with traumas that argue against peace. At the same time, all three desperately seek it, although the means and the final goals vary. It is a tale of revenge, atonement, and resolution, where the players all want one thing: redemption.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular "Twilight" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival.

programme.title: Nothing Compares
programme.desc: An intimate look into the life of controversial Irish singer-songwriter Sinad O'Connor. Beginning with the release of her debut album in 1987, the narrative charts six years in O'Connor's career filled with rebellion, iconoclasm, and creativity as the musician strove to rewrite the script of mainstream music and femininity in the face of rampant sociopolitical and sociocultural change.

programme.title: Meet Me in the Bathroom
programme.desc: An in-depth look into the early 2000s New York City rock scene. In a time when many thought the city would no longer produce iconic rock bands, a rebirth of sorts swept through the city. Following bands like The Strokes, LCD Soundsystem, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, and more, this documentary takes you back to where it all started. Based on the book written by Lizzie Goodman.

programme.title: The First Hour
programme.desc: Ant and Sav play the first 60 minutes of Injustice 2.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Stephenie Meyer's romantic and suspenseful best seller that started the phenomenon comes to life in this action-packed chronicle of the modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson star. Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular "Twilight" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival.

programme.title: Ape vs. Monster
programme.desc: An ape who has become lost in the vast expanse of space ends up crash landing on Earth; this emits an unusual sludge and forces him and a gigantic scorpion monster into an all-out battle for dominance.

programme.title: S.O.S. Survive or Sacrifice
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters reunite on a Mediterranean Island and agree to an exciting ride on a hot air balloon with the locals. But when a freak accident carries the balloon out to sea, the group find themselves battling for survival. Soon, the situation begins spiraling out of control, marking their lives forever.

programme.title: Inbetween Girl
programme.desc: A teenage girl turns to secret hookups after her parents' divorce.

programme.title: Broken Diamonds
programme.desc: Twentysomething Scott yearns to travel to Paris to inspire his writing. Yet his plans soon crumble after his father's unexpected death, leaving Scott responsible for minding his sister, Cindy, whose mental health struggles increasingly plague her. Scott must then confront the true motivations behind his aspirations if he is to prevent his broken family from sinking.

programme.title: Adam Sandler's Eight Crazy Nights
programme.desc: A partying troublemaker learns about holiday spirit when a judge sentences him to community service as a referee for a kids team.

programme.title: Lacy's Christmas Do-Over
programme.desc: Lacy, a career-driven business woman, goes to a B&B in Illinois at the advice of a new therapist. There she finds herself stuck in a mystical, small Christmas town, reliving the same day over and over. Lacy must figure out how to escape.

programme.title: Six Minutes to Midnight
programme.desc: Summer 1939. The Nazi High Command send their daughters to finishing school in England. A teacher senses the coming atrocities, but must navigate a web of double-agents to raise the alarm.

programme.title: The Disaster Artist
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy-drama based on actual events, weirdo auteur Tommy Wiseau befriends struggling actor Greg Sestero. Together, they make a movie called "The Room," which soon becomes a cult hit due to its staggering badness.

programme.title: Last Call
programme.desc: Real estate tycoon Mick ventures back to his close-knit Philadelphia suburb, revisiting his former haunts. He later receives an offer to develop the neighborhood's beloved watering hole, forcing him to consider the future of the property as he entertains the notion of resurrecting the family bar.

programme.title: Boy
programme.desc: In this coming-of-age tale set in 1984, a Michael Jackson-obsessed Maori boy and his brother deal with unexpected problems when their ex-con father returns and tries to retrieve money from a successful robbery.

programme.title: Margaux
programme.desc: Eager for a weekend getaway of parties and relaxation, a group of twentysomethings rents a smart home vacation rental. Yet the home's sophisticated artificial intelligence programming system soon takes control, forcing the friends to fight their way out or face their end.

programme.title: Jackass Number Two
programme.desc: Johnny Knoxville, Steve-O and the rest of the gang are back for another round of dangerous stunts and depraved pranks in a sequel that's even more extreme than the first movie.

programme.title: Mid90s
programme.desc: A thirteen-year-old boy finds solace in a group of older skaters in L.A. as he tries to avoid the tumultuous home life he shares with his bullish brother and despondent mother. Even as life begins to make sense, he knows this summer can't last forever in a 90s haze.

programme.title: In Fabric
programme.desc: A dress unleashes a curse on a lonely divorcee.

programme.title: Freedom Writers
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Hilary Swank stars in this powerful true story of an idealistic teacher at a tough high school in California who tries to inspire her troubled students through journal writing. Patrick Dempsey, Scott Glenn, Imelda Staunton, April Lee Hernandez. Directed by Richard LaGravenese.

programme.title: Poser
programme.desc: Lennon is an aspiring podcaster who interviews local musicians she admires. As she starts to leave her comfort zone, her interviews lead her to her own musical ambitions. Finding inspiration from the music she admires, Lennon embarks on a journey of self-discovery and enlightenment.

programme.title: Menashe
programme.desc: This moving drama centers on a Hasidic Jewish man living in New York City who fights to retain custody of his son after his wife's death, as tradition dictates that the boy must be raised in a household with a mother. If he doesn't remarry quickly, his son will be adopted by his late spouse's stern brother.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A washed-up American actor experiences culture shock while filming a whiskey commercial in Tokyo, but finds solace in his connection with a married 20-something in this enthralling tale of two strangers in a strange land.

programme.title: Kobe Bryant's Muse
programme.desc: An in-depth look at the on and off-court life of the 16-time NBA All-Star, who has helped the Lakers win five championships. Included: the mentors, allies and rivalries that have shaped his career, and his thoughts on what lies ahead.

programme.title: Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure
programme.desc: Two dim best friends who dream of being famous rock stars time-travel in order to bring ancient figures to modern times so that they can pass a history class and graduate. If they fail, one of them will be forced to join the military.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey
programme.desc: Bill and Ted's lyrics create a utopian future, so a tyrant sends evil robot versions of the simple-minded heroes back in time to kill them. Bill and Ted end up in the afterlife, and must outsmart the Grim Reaper in order to return to the land of the living to stop their evil counterparts and save their girlfriends.

programme.title: Almost Famous
programme.desc: This spirited semiautobiography rocks! Writer-director Cameron Crowe, who wrote for Rolling Stone as a 15-year-old, charts a teen's coming of age around the Age of Aquarius. Patrick Fugit is wonderful as the young incarnation of Crowe, who learns all about life, love, sex, drugs and especially rock and roll while touring with a rising band. Kate Hudson, Billy Crudup, Frances McDormand.

programme.title: Jerry & Marge Go Large
programme.desc: Jerry Selbee stumbles upon a mathematical hole in the Massachusetts lottery and recruits his wife, Marge, to help him secure the hefty cash prize.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Diane Keaton are dynamic in this witty romantic comedy. Nicholson plays an aging Lothario with a young girlfriend. He meets his soul mate, however, when he's introduced to his lover's mother, a playwright who can't stand the sight of him.

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Billy Bob Thornton is hilarious in this deliciously warped holiday comedy from director Terry Zwigoff ("Ghost World"). Thornton plays a vulgar, boozy con artist who robs the department stores where he works as St. Nick.

programme.title: Bad Santa 2
programme.desc: In this hysterical sequel to the 2003 cult hit, professional thief and Santa impersonator Willie Soke teams up with his dwarf sidekick and hell-raising mother for his latest heist: robbing a Chicago charity during Christmas Eve. However, he begins to have second thoughts about the caper when he falls for the charity's director.

programme.title: Ernest Saves Christmas
programme.desc: Ernest scrambles to find a successor for Santa Claus in this Yuletide comedy.

programme.title: Adam Sandler's Eight Crazy Nights
programme.desc: A partying troublemaker learns about holiday spirit when a judge sentences him to community service as a referee for a kids team.

programme.title: Angels Sing
programme.desc: A man is forced to confront his past during the holiday season.

programme.title: Wonderful Time of the Year, A
programme.desc: The Marsh family is getting together for their first Christmas Eve after three years of pandemic lockdown.

programme.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation 2: Cousin Eddie's Island Adventure
programme.desc: When Cousin Eddie is fired from his job at a nuclear facility and replaced by a monkey, his boss worries he will sue and offers his family a Christmas vacation in the South pacific. They get shipwrecked on a small island and brave the elements together.

programme.title: A Very British Christmas
programme.desc: American opera singer Jessica Bailey's flight to her concert in Vienna becomes delayed in a remote area of England. The only place to stay is a bed-and-breakfast in Pine Falls, an enchanting village run by a young, handsome, widower Andrew with his precocious daughter, Katie. Spending time with them allows romance to blossom as Jessica learns he is an amazing artist, but a struggling entrepreneur. With snowflakes in the air, Jessica faces a choice: career or love.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: Texan Renee Zellweger boasts a perfect English accent in this delightful adaptation of Helen Fielding's novel. She plays Bridget, a London "singleton" desperate to lose weight, cut down on her vices and find Mr. Right. The film chronicles her romantic entanglements with two gents: her playboy boss (Hugh Grant) and a snooty lawyer (Colin Firth). Jim Broadbent, Gemma Jones.

programme.title: Mr. Malcolm's List
programme.desc: Jeremy Malcolm is the most sought bachelor in the English countryside. Rumors surface of a list that lays out all the perfect qualities for Mr. Malcolm's future wife. A suitor from out of town hears about Mr. Malcolm and is convinced she can win him over. Based on the novel Mr. Malcolm's List by Suzanne Allain.

programme.title: Hello, My Name Is Doris
programme.desc: Sixtysomething spinster Doris tries to woo her much-younger coworker John in this charming comedy-drama. To her surprise, she is welcomed into John's social circle, although her new and exciting life strains her relationship with her best friend.

programme.title: Contagion
programme.desc: In this intense ensemble thriller about a virus that quickly becomes a global pandemic, a husband (Matt Damon) copes with the sudden death of his wife, while a doctor (Kate Winslet) puts herself at risk to find a cure and an activist blogger (Jude Law) stokes society's paranoia. Directed by Steven Soderbergh.

programme.title: Matt Rogers: Have You Heard of Christmas?
programme.desc: A yuletide extravaganza of soon-to-be-classic songs and comedy sketches.

programme.title: Club C. Presents a Queer Comedy Extravaganza!
programme.desc: Emmy nominee and Tony winner Alan C. hosts this cabaret-style gathering featuring seven up-and-coming queer comedians that represent not only the diversity of the queer spectrum, but also of comedy styling, from stand-up to characters to musical performances. The 75-minute special features Joe Castle Baker, Julia Shiplett, duo Zach Teague & Drew Lausch, Nori Reed, Pat Regan, and Larry Owens.

programme.title: Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Fran Drescher leads a cast of mature women of stand-up in a night of uninhibited comedy. Performers include Carole Montgomery, Luenell, Lynne Koplitz, Kerri Louise and Vanessa Hollingshead.

programme.title: More Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Caroline Rhea headlines a night of uninhibited stand-up comedy. Performers include Carol Leifer, Tammy Pescatelli, Thea Vidale, Carole Montgomery and Julia Scotti.

programme.title: Pete Lee: Tall, Dark, and Pleasant
programme.desc: Conflict-averse comedian Pete Lee talks sex, drugs and being too nice.

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: The marches from Selma, Ala., to Montgomery to secure voting rights for black Americans are depicted in this powerfully moving docudrama set during the U.S. Civil Rights Movement, and which focuses on the actions of Martin Luther King Jr.

programme.title: Bandit
programme.desc: Gilbert Galvan Jr. was known as The Flying Bandit during the 1980s. Gilbert escapes from a prison in Michigan and crosses the border toward Canada. While there, he changes his identity, falls for a social worker, and starts robbing banks. As he gets good at it, he also catches the attention of the media and, eventually, the authorities.

programme.title: August: Osage County
programme.desc: In this hilarious and heartbreaking comedy-drama, a dysfunctional family air their dirty laundry as they gather to mourn the loss of their patriarch. Meanwhile, the deceased's widow struggles with mouth cancer and a growing dependency on pain pills. Based on the Tony-winning play.

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
programme.desc: Heiress Florence Foster Jenkins longs to become an opera star in 1940s New York, despite possessing a horrible singing voice. With the help of her husband and a talented musician, she finds a strange kind of success in this heartwarming biopic.

programme.title: The Giver
programme.desc: In this thrilling adaptation of the beloved novel, a young man living in a totalitarian society learns the true history of his community from a mysterious yet seemingly benevolent figure known as the Giver. In time, the youth finds the burden of the truth too great to bear and plots to escape.

programme.title: Confess, Fletch
programme.desc: Confess, Fletch is a reboot of the classic crime-comedy film. This time, Fletch becomes the main suspect in a series of murders while investigating thieves that stole his girlfriend's art collection. To exonerate himself, Fletch begins his own investigation into the murders and discovers a lot of people could be the guilty party, including his art collecting girlfriend.

programme.title: The Bling Ring
programme.desc: In this trenchant take on celebrity culture, a group of Los Angeles teens burglarize the homes of the rich and famous, but their criminal pastime turns treacherous as their obsession with luxury goods grows all-consuming.

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: In this stunning thriller shot in one continuous and unedited take, a beautiful Spanish party girl in Berlin unwittingly becomes an accessory to a bank robbery after she befriends a group of men at a bar.

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Tammy questions whether George can handle the pressures of superstardom.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Ziwe finds out what the ladies go through to become the next Miss Universe.

programme.desc: A filmmaker profiles an unknown black actress from the 1930s in this comedy.

programme.desc: A thief stumbles into the penthouse apartment of Grace Jones and Hean-Paul Houde.

programme.title: Elizabeth: A Portrait in Part(s)
programme.desc: A documentary on the life of Queen Elizabeth II, the longest-lived, longest reigning British monarch and longest serving female head of state in history.

programme.title: Ms. Purple
programme.desc: Two estranged Korean-American siblings reconnect as their father's life draws to an end. The sister, a karaoke hostel working in Los Angeles' Koreatown, is forced to ask her brother for help when their father's live-in nurse makes an unexpected exit.

programme.title: And So It Goes
programme.desc: In this endearing comedy-drama, a selfish real-estate agent is forced to care for his estranged son's 9-year-old daughter, and attempts to pawn her off on his kindly neighbor. In time, the little girl brings the two contentious adults together.

programme.title: Sophie Jones
programme.desc: A sixteen-year-old teenager struggles to cope with grief after her mother unexpectedly passes away. She engages in a series of emotionless hookups to distract herself, but eventually comes to terms with loss and the promise of the future as she makes the transition from high school to college.

programme.title: All I Want for Christmas (2021)
programme.desc: A young girl stumbles upon a Christmas caper involving a fleet of small robots that just might not be the toys they seem, while helping several friends get Santa's attention for putting them on the naughty list.

programme.title: Out of the Blue
programme.desc: Connor is a parolee trying to get his life on track. By chance, he runs into a woman named Marilyn at her secret beach hideout. Marilyn, a married woman, instantly becomes attracted to Connor, and they develop a romantic relationship. As they figure out how to be together forever, the extramarital relationship struggles to survive in the shadows.

programme.title: Trapped in Paradise
programme.desc: Three bumbling brothers pull a bank heist on Christmas Eve, but struggle to escape the small-town scene of the crime.

programme.title: The Farewell
programme.desc: After her beloved grandmother is diagnosed with terminal cancer, a Chinese-American woman returns to China for a family gathering secretly designed to say goodbye to the matriarch. However, when it becomes apparent that grandma is the only one unaware of the diagnosis, she struggles to keep the secret.

programme.title: Dating & New York
programme.desc: After crossing each other's paths on dating app Meet Cute, a boy and a girl lead what seems like a short-lived romance. The pair psych themselves out of a conventional relationship instead favoring the 'friends with benefits' mantra as they navigate modern day love in New York City.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: Alice and Tess discover some lies in their relationship; Shane has nowhere else to go to; Dani's romcom fantasy is ruined after she finds something that will test Sophie and Finley's trust; Micah and Maribel struggle with parenthood.

programme.title: Zola
programme.desc: This comedy-drama film is inspired by the Twitter thread that went viral in 2015. Tweeting under her account handle @_zolarmoon, Zola tweets about meeting a sex worker named Stefani and how their immediate friendship led to a strange road trip. The women aim to reach Florida and earn money by dancing in various strip clubs. However, they run into several mishaps and misadventures as they travel with Stefani's male companions: her boyfriend Derrek and her pimp named X.

programme.title: Becky
programme.desc: After her mother's death, 13-year-old Becky goes on a weekend getaway with her father, Jeff, to bond and reconnect with him. Jeff, however, has a different planhe brings along his new girlfriend Kayla in an attempt to bring her closer to Becky. However, when four newly-escaped prisoners show up and break into the lake house they are staying at, their plans change, and the fun trip becomes a nightmare. Becky now has to do everything she can to keep the three of them safe.

programme.title: High Life
programme.desc: Monte is one of several death row inmates given the opportunity to forgo their sentence in exchange for manning a suicide space mission to harvest energy from near a black hole. The ship's doctor is also conducting an experiment of her own, obsessively testing humans' ability to reproduce in space. The ragtag crew's close quarters and grim fate breed dissent and ultimately brutal violence.

programme.title: Begin Again
programme.desc: An ambitious female singer moves to NYC in search of stardom, but finds only heartache until she meets a disgraced music executive who helps her down the road to fame. Their subsequent collaboration transforms both of them in this charming comedy-drama.

programme.title: Girlhood
programme.desc: In this powerful coming-of-age story, a frustrated teen takes her fate into her own hands and drops out of school to join a gang. However, her dysfunctional relationship with an older man leads her to realize that her new lifestyle is unsustainable.

programme.title: Love Story
programme.desc: A high society law student and middle-class musician marry; only to have their whirlwind romance come to a screeching halt when the young woman receives a cancer diagnosis.

programme.title: Hello, My Name Is Doris
programme.desc: Sixtysomething spinster Doris tries to woo her much-younger coworker John in this charming comedy-drama. To her surprise, she is welcomed into John's social circle, although her new and exciting life strains her relationship with her best friend.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: This delightfully offbeat comedy centers on a single woman who decides to conceive via artificial insemination. But seven years later, she reunites with a friend and comes to question the child's paternity after he recalls a last-minute mix-up involving the sperm sample she used.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: Cold Mountain
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman, Jude Law and Best Supporting Actress Rene Zellweger star in Anthony Minghella's sweeping Civil War epic about a pampered preacher's daughter struggling to survive while waiting for her beau to return from battle.

programme.title: Happily N'ever After 2: Snow White - Another Bite at the Apple
programme.desc: A teenage Snow White who would rather hang out with fairy-tale friends than lend a hand to the peasants soon realizes she's the one who will need help when a witch intends to wed her father and take control of the entire kingdom.

programme.title: A Belle for Christmas
programme.desc: A boy and his sister set out to recover their newly adopted puppy after their father's girlfriend steals it.

programme.title: Christmas All Over Again
programme.desc: A boy has to overcome his inner Scrooge or remain caught in a cycle where every day is a Christmas without any presents.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: Arnold Schwarzenegger shows his lighter side in this jolly Yuletide comedy. He plays an overworked father who scrambles to find the perfect gift for his son on Christmas Eve. Desperate to make up for previous disappointments, he searches the city and battles frantic parents, a toy-crazed postal worker and a deviant Santa to find the elusive Turbo Man doll. Sinbad, Phil Hartman, Rita Wilson.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice and Zombies
programme.desc: In this delightfully ghoulish spin on the beloved Jane Austen novel, spunky martial artist Elizabeth Bennet and wealthy zombie killer Mr. Darcy fall in love despite their class differences while battling an undead uprising in 19th-century England.

programme.title: Happy Christmas
programme.desc: A party girl moves in with her brother's family and forges an unlikely bond with his uptight wife in this poignant comedy-drama. As Christmas approaches, the two women begin looking to each other for the strength to face the future.

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: John Cusack and Kate Beckinsale decide to let fate be their guide in this charming comedy about a man and woman who share an undeniable attraction when they meet, but concoct a series of experiments to determine if they are truly meant for each other. Jeremy Piven, Molly Shannon, John Corbett, Bridget Moynahan, Eugene Levy.

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space.

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Presents 1st Amendment Stand Up
programme.desc: Host Martin Lawrence welcomes up-and-coming African-American comedians to the stage, including Esau McGraw, Deon Cole, and Chalant.

programme.title: Kidco
programme.desc: An entrepreneurial youngster's success rouses his adult competitors to a court battle. Scott Schwartz. Nene: Cinnamon Idles. Belle: Tristine Skyler. June: Elizabeth Gorcey.

programme.title: The Meddler
programme.desc: A widow named Marnie relocates to L.A. to be closer to her daughter Lori, a Hollywood screenwriter. While Lori frets about her mom's smothering ways, Marnie keeps getting involved in the lives of others in this charming comedy-drama: She dates an ex-cop, helps an Apple Store employee study for school and pays for a lesbian wedding.

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space.

programme.title: Christmas vs The Walters
